page.title: 01LANDSCAPE, EGLOSKERRY AREA
page.content: Our twelve square kilometre block is a rural area.It has three main villages {Egloskerry, Tregeare}and {Pipers Pool, the largest being Egloskerry.In Egloskerry there are about 40 houses,a post office,a church,a chapel,a school and a village hall.There are about 10 houses at Tregeare,mostly farmhouses as Tregeare is a farming area.Pipers Pool consists of about a dozen houses and a chapel.The main high points on the block are by Pipers Pool, (735 ft. above sea level) by Tregearedown Beacon (718 ft. above sea level) and on Red Down (634 ft. above sea level.)There are about 17 farms. There is a Manor at Tregeare which owns most of the farms,houses and land in Tregeare.A minor road runs through Egloskerry and a main road, the A395 which links the A30 and A39 runs through Pipers Pool.
